title: 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe
description: This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe has remained registered in California from new through the current owner's purchase in 2016 from its original owner, and its turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six and a four-speed manual transaxle have since been rebuilt. Finished in black over Silver Grey leather upholstery, the car is equipped with 16" Fuchs alloy wheels, a limited-slip differential, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a rear spoiler, power-adjustable seats, a Kenwood head unit, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo coupe is offered on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean California title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #185,653.
text: This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe has remained registered in California from new through the current owner’s purchase in 2016 from its original owner, and its turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six and a four-speed manual transaxle have since been rebuilt. Finished in black over Silver Grey leather upholstery, the car is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, a limited-slip differential, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a rear spoiler, power-adjustable seats, a Kenwood head unit, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo coupe is offered on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean California title. The car is finished in black and features a sunroof, fog lights, a rear spoiler, stone guards ahead of the rear wheels, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below. Staggered-width 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs. The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Silver Grey leather with darker piping and are complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Kenwood head unit. The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 99k miles. The speedometer was repaired in October 2024. The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. An engine rebuild was completed in 2017, at which time the intake and exhaust valves, rod bearings, main bearings, piston rings, timing chain rail, oil hoses, fuel lines, drive belt, spark plugs, and various gaskets and seals were replaced. The engine mounts were replaced in 2023 and the battery was replaced in 2024. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The transaxle was rebuilt and the clutch, rear main seal, and sector shaft sleeve were replaced in February 2023. The seller notes that the options code sticker is present under the front hood. L700 – Black paint HQ – Silver Grey leather C03 – Version for California 158 – Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette stereo 220 – Limited-slip differential 533 – Alarm system 650 – Power sunroof 900 – Accession of the car at the factory / Export car with catalytic converter 975 – Velour carpeting in trunk The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from its first entry in December 1999. html:
This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe has remained registered in California from new through the current owner’s purchase in 2016 from its original owner, and its turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six and a four-speed manual transaxle have since been rebuilt. Finished in black over Silver Grey leather upholstery, the car is equipped with 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, a limited-slip differential, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a rear spoiler, power-adjustable seats, a Kenwood head unit, and air conditioning. This 930 Turbo coupe is offered on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in black and features a sunroof, fog lights, a rear spoiler, stone guards ahead of the rear wheels, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Staggered-width 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs.

The power-adjustable front seats are upholstered in Silver Grey leather with darker piping and are complemented by a color-coordinated center console, door panels, and carpeting. Amenities include air conditioning, an analog clock, power windows, and a Kenwood head unit.

The four-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 99k miles. The speedometer was repaired in October 2024.

The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. An engine rebuild was completed in 2017, at which time the intake and exhaust valves, rod bearings, main bearings, piston rings, timing chain rail, oil hoses, fuel lines, drive belt, spark plugs, and various gaskets and seals were replaced. The engine mounts were replaced in 2023 and the battery was replaced in 2024.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The transaxle was rebuilt and the clutch, rear main seal, and sector shaft sleeve were replaced in February 2023.

The seller notes that the options code sticker is present under the front hood.

  • L700 – Black paint
  • HQ – Silver Grey leather
  • C03 – Version for California
  • 158 – Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette stereo
  • 220 – Limited-slip differential
  • 533 – Alarm system
  • 650 – Power sunroof
  • 900 – Accession of the car at the factory / Export car with catalytic converter
  • 975 – Velour carpeting in trunk

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage from its first entry in December 1999.
